source.author: Conran, J.G.
source.title: Liliaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conran, J.G. (1994). Liliaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves less than 30 cm long; flowers few; scape bracts small; plants alpine
Leaves more than 50 cm long; flowers numerous; scape bracts large; rare plants of wet gullies

Leaves discolourous or concolourous, upper leaf surface usually becoming glabrous and green with age; male inflorescence exserted beyond leaf bases, perianth segments less than 5 mm long; berry red, 1-locular
Leaves concolourous, both surfaces grey-green with persistent scales; male inflorescences contracted, not extending beyond leaf bases, perianth segments 5–10 mm long; berry orange-yellow, 3-locular
